MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKSize CanvasSize { get; }
.property instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKSize CanvasSize

Docs.remarks: The canvas size may be different to the view size as a result of the current device's pixel density.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed
public bool IgnorePixelScaling { get; set; }
.property instance bool IgnorePixelScaling

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the drawing canvas should be resized on high resolution displays.
Docs.remarks: By default, when false, the canvas is resized to 1 canvas pixel per display pixel. When true, the canvas is resized to device independent pixels, and then stretched to fill the view. Although performance is improved and all objects are the same size on different display densities, blurring and pixellation may occur.

Docs.param: The canvas on which the background will be drawn.
Docs.summary: Implement this to do your drawing.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnDraw (SkiaSharp.SKSurface surface, SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDraw(class SkiaSharp.SKSurface surface, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info) cil managed

Docs.summary: Implement this to draw on the canvas.

remarks.para: There are two ways to draw on this surface: by overriding the method, or by attaching a handler to the event. If the method is overriden, then the base must be called.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void OnSizeChanged (int w, int h, int oldw, int oldh);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnSizeChanged(int32 w, int32 h, int32 oldw, int32 oldh) cil managed

Docs.summary: This is called during layout when the size of this view has changed. If you were just added to the view hierarchy, you're called with the old values of 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public event EventHandler<SkiaSharp.Views.Android.SKPaintSurfaceEventArgs> PaintSurface;
.event class System.EventHandler`1<class SkiaSharp.Views.Android.SKPaintSurfaceEventArgs> PaintSurface

Docs.summary: Occurs when the the canvas needs to be re-drawn.

remarks.para: There are two ways to draw on this surface: by overriding the method, or by attaching a handler to the event.
